body_and_class.description: Body styles and market segments used in EU and US (sedan/saloon, hatchback, SUV, etc.) aligned with Euro segments and US EPA size classes.

body_styles.name: Sedan
body_styles.description: Three-box body with separate engine, passenger, and trunk compartments; typically 4 doors.

body_styles.name: Hatchback
body_styles.description: Two-box design with rear hatch door and folding rear seats for cargo flexibility.

body_styles.name: Liftback
body_styles.description: Sloped rear with a full hatch like a hatchback but with sedan-like profile.

body_styles.name: Coupe
body_styles.description: Two-door sporty body, fixed roof, typically a sloping rear and 2+2 seating.

body_styles.name: Convertible
body_styles.description: Open-top variant with retractable soft or hard roof.

body_styles.name: Roadster
body_styles.description: Two-seat open-top sports car emphasizing light weight and handling.

body_styles.name: Station Wagon
body_styles.description: Extended roofline with rear cargo area accessed by a tailgate.

body_styles.name: Fastback
body_styles.description: Continuous slope from roof to tail; may be coupe or sedan derivative.

body_styles.name: MPV
body_styles.description: Multi-purpose vehicle with flexible seating for families and cargo.

body_styles.name: SUV
body_styles.description: Sport utility vehicle with elevated ride height; body-on-frame or unibody.

body_styles.name: Crossover
body_styles.description: Unibody SUV-like vehicle based on a car platform.

body_styles.name: Pickup
body_styles.description: Open cargo bed behind a passenger cab; light truck.

body_styles.name: Buggy
body_styles.description: Lightweight open vehicle, often for sand/off-road leisure.

market_segments.description: City cars; smallest mainstream class such as Fiat 500, Toyota Aygo.
Superminis/subcompacts such as Ford Fiesta, VW Polo.
Small family/compact cars such as Honda Civic, Toyota Corolla.
Large family/mid-size cars such as Toyota Camry, VW Passat.
Executive/large cars including luxury and non-luxury full-size.
Luxury saloons/limousines such as Mercedes S-Class.
Sports/performance cars including roadsters and supercars.
SUVs by size: subcompact, compact, mid-size, full-size.
